provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Respondents must not misrepresent their privacy, security, or data practices related to Covered Information.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Annual Certification
provisions.summary: Respondents must provide annual certifications from the CEO or senior officer confirming compliance with the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Covered Incident Reports
provisions.summary: Respondents must report to the FTC any Covered Incidents affecting 500 or more consumers within 10 days of notifying government entities.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondents must obtain signed acknowledgments of the Order from all relevant personnel and entities for 20 years.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Compliance Reports and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondents must submit annual compliance reports and timely notices of any structural changes or bankruptcy proceedings.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondents must create and retain records for 20 years documenting compliance with all provisions of the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC has authority to monitor compliance through requests for reports, depositions, document production, and interviews.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Modification of Original Decision and Order
provisions.summary: This Order supersedes the 2010 Decision and Order previously issued against Rite Aid.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: The Order is effective upon publication on ftc.gov and terminates 20 years from issuance or from the most recent complaint filing, whichever is later.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Respondents must not misrepresent in any manner the extent to which they maintain and protect the privacy, security, confidentiality, or integrity of Covered Information.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Annual Certification
provisions.summary: One year after issuance, and each year thereafter, Respondents must provide the FTC with a sworn certification from a senior executive confirming compliance with the Order, absence of uncorrected/undisclosed material noncompliance, and a description of all qualifying Covered Incidents during the certified period.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Covered Incident Reports
provisions.summary: Within 10 days of notifying any U.S. government entity of a Covered Incident affecting 500 or more consumers, Respondents must submit a detailed report to the FTC.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondents must submit acknowledgment of receipt of the Order within 10 days, deliver copies to all principals, officers, directors, subsidiaries, and relevant employees, and obtain signed acknowledgments within 30 days of delivery.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Compliance Reports and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondents must submit annual compliance reports, compliance notices within 14 days of changes in contact information or corporate structure, and bankruptcy filing notices within 14 days of filing.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC is authorized to monitor Respondents' compliance through requests for reports and records, depositions, discovery, direct communications, interviews, and undercover methods, with Respondents obligated to respond within 14 days of written requests.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Modification of Original Decision and Order
provisions.summary: This Decision and Order supersedes and replaces the Commission's 2010 Decision and Order in In re Rite Aid Corporation, C-4308.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates and Duration
provisions.summary: The Order is effective upon publication on the FTC's website and terminates 20 years from issuance or 20 years from the most recent federal court complaint alleging a violation, whichever is later, with specified exceptions for individual provisions, non-defendant respondents, and dismissed complaints.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Children's Privacy
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently enjoined from making any misrepresentation in a website's privacy policy or elsewhere about the collection, use, or disclosure of children's personal information, or about procedures to maintain its confidentiality, security, or integrity.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c), and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)

provisions.title: Consumer Education Remedy — FTC KidzPrivacy Notice
provisions.summary: For five years, defendants must place a clear and conspicuous FTC KidzPrivacy notice in their privacy policy, direct notices to parents, and at each personal information collection point on any child-directed website or online service.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c), and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)

provisions.title: Deletion of Previously Collected Children's Personal Information
provisions.summary: Defendants must delete all personal information previously collected from children through www.bigmailbox.com prior to entry of the Consent Decree.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c), and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)

provisions.title: Initial Compliance Report
provisions.summary: Within 60 days of entry, defendants must file a written compliance report with the FTC detailing their compliance with the Consent Decree, including registration processes, privacy notices, parental consent methods, and data security procedures.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c), and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)

provisions.title: Notification of Employment Changes — Nolan Quan
provisions.summary: For three years, defendant Nolan Quan must notify the FTC of any discontinuation of his current business or employment, or any new involvement in an Internet-related business involving online collection of personal information.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c), and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)

provisions.title: Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court has jurisdiction over the subject matter and the parties to this action.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c), and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)

provisions.title: Basis for Claims
provisions.summary: The Complaint states a claim upon which relief may be granted under COPPA and the FTC Act.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c), and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)

provisions.title: Injunction — Prohibition Against COPPA Rule Violations
provisions.summary: Defendant and all associated persons are permanently enjoined from violating any provision of the COPPA Rule, directly or through any subsidiary, website, or other device.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c), and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)

provisions.title: Consumer Education Remedy — FTC Privacy Notice
provisions.summary: For five years, defendant must post a clear and conspicuous FTC children's privacy notice (with hyperlink) in its privacy policy, direct notices to parents, and at each location where personal information is collected on children-directed websites.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c), and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)

provisions.title: Civil Penalty — Amount
provisions.summary: Defendant must pay a civil penalty of $35,000 to the United States pursuant to the FTC Act.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c), and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)

provisions.title: Civil Penalty — Payment Method and Delivery
provisions.summary: Defendant must pay the civil penalty on the date of entry of the Consent Decree by certified or cashier's check payable to the Treasurer of the United States, delivered to the Office of Consumer Litigation.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c), and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)

provisions.title: Civil Penalty — Default Interest
provisions.summary: If defendant defaults on payment for more than ten days, the full unpaid penalty plus statutory interest becomes immediately due and payable.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c), and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)

provisions.title: Compliance — Deletion of Children's Personal Information
provisions.summary: Defendant must delete all personal information collected from children through www.insidetheweb.com between April 21, 2000 and the date of entry of the Consent Decree.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c), and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)

provisions.title: Compliance — Distribution of Consent Decree to Current Personnel
provisions.summary: Within thirty days, defendant must distribute copies of the Consent Decree and the COPPA compliance guide to all current principals, officers, directors, and relevant employees, obtain signed acknowledgments, and report compliance to the Commission within ten days thereafter.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c), and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)

provisions.title: Compliance — Distribution of Consent Decree to Future Personnel
provisions.summary: Defendant must provide the Consent Decree and compliance guide to all future principals, officers, directors, and relevant employees within thirty days of assuming their position, secure signed acknowledgments, maintain copies, and make them available to the FTC upon request.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c), and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting — Initial Written Report
provisions.summary: Within sixty days of entry, defendant must file a detailed written compliance report with the Commission covering privacy notices, parental consent procedures, data collection practices, and security measures for all Rule-covered websites.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c), and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping — Document Retention for Compliance
provisions.summary: For five years, defendant must maintain and make available to the FTC within seven days of request all documents demonstrating compliance, including web page copies, information collection forms, and representations about data practices.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c), and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)

provisions.title: Compliance — Notice of Business Changes
provisions.summary: Defendant must notify the Commission at least thirty days before any business change that may affect compliance obligations under the Consent Decree, including mergers, dissolutions, bankruptcies, or name/address changes.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c), and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)

provisions.title: Compliance — Taxpayer Identifying Number
provisions.summary: Defendant must furnish its taxpayer identifying number to the FTC in accordance with 31 U.S.C. § 7701 for purposes of collecting and reporting on any delinquent amounts.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c), and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)

provisions.title: Compliance — Submission Address
provisions.summary: All reports, submissions, and notices required by Paragraphs 11–17 must be sent by certified mail to the Associate Director, Division of Advertising Practices, FTC.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c), and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)

provisions.title: Continuing Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction to interpret, modify, enforce, or punish violations of the Consent Decree upon application by any party.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c), and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)

provisions.title: Consumer Education Remedy — FTC KidzPrivacy Notice
provisions.summary: For five years from entry of the Consent Decree, defendants must place a clear and conspicuous FTC KidzPrivacy notice (with hyperlink) in their privacy policy, direct notices to parents, and at each location on their website(s) where personal information is collected.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c), and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)

provisions.title: Deletion of Children's Personal Information
provisions.summary: Defendants must delete all personal information collected from children through www.girlslife.com between April 21, 2000 and the date of entry of this Consent Decree.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c), and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Within sixty days of entry and at such other times as the FTC requires, defendants must file a sworn written compliance report detailing their adherence to the Consent Decree, including copies of privacy notices, parental consent methods, and data security procedures.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c), and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Violating GLB Safeguards and Privacy Rules
provisions.summary: Respondents must not violate any provision of the GLB Act's Safeguards Rule (16 C.F.R. Part 314) or Privacy Rule (16 C.F.R. Part 313), directly or through any corporate entity or device.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1), and Title V of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801 et seq.

provisions.title: Prohibition Against False or Misleading Representations About Personal Information
provisions.summary: Respondent is prohibited from making any false or misleading representation, express or implied, regarding the collection, use, or disclosure of personally identifiable information from consumers.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Prohibition on Disclosure of Pre-Order Consumer Information for Marketing
provisions.summary: Respondent must not sell, rent, or disclose to any third party for marketing purposes any personally identifiable information collected from consumers prior to the date of service of this Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Conditional Prohibition on Disclosure of Post-Order Consumer Information for Marketing
provisions.summary: Respondent must not sell, rent, or disclose post-Order consumer information for marketing purposes unless it first provided the merchant customer a clear written notice and obtained written certification, or provided a clear disclosure directly to consumers about Respondent's data practices.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Monetary Disgorgement Payment
provisions.summary: Respondent must pay $9,101.63 to the United States Treasury as disgorgement within five days of service of this Order, with interest accruing on any default balance.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain and make available to the FTC for five years all documents demonstrating compliance with the Order, including privacy statements, merchant notices and certifications, and records of third-party disclosures.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgment and Delivery
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of the Order to all current and future principals, officers, directors, managers, employees, agents, and representatives with relevant responsibilities, and obtain signed, dated acknowledgments of receipt.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Notification of Corporate Changes
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the FTC at least 30 days prior to any corporate change that may affect compliance obligations under this Order, including dissolution, sale, merger, bankruptcy filings, or name/address changes.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file a written compliance report with the FTC within sixty days of service of this Order, and at such other times as the FTC may require.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: The Order terminates on April 19, 2025, or twenty years from the most recent date a complaint alleging an Order violation is filed in federal court, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Security
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent in any manner, expressly or by implication, the extent to which it maintains and protects the privacy, confidentiality, security, or integrity of personal information collected from consumers.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq

provisions.title: Comprehensive Information Security Program
provisions.summary: Respondent must establish, implement, and maintain a comprehensive information security program, fully documented in writing, with administrative, technical, and physical safeguards appropriate to the sensitivity of personal information collected.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq

provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: No Use of Improperly Obtained Information in Collections
provisions.summary: Respondent is permanently restrained and enjoined from using, in connection with collecting or attempting to collect a debt, money, or property pursuant to a covered rent-to-own transaction, any information or data obtained in a manner that does not comply with Parts I, II, and III of this Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Protection of Data
provisions.summary: Respondent must delete or destroy all user data previously gathered using any monitoring or geophysical location tracking technology that does not comply with Parts I, II, and III of this Order, and must render information collected unreadable during transmission.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: No Misrepresentations About Privacy
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent, in any manner, expressly or by implication, the extent to which respondent maintains and protects the security, privacy, or confidentiality of any personal information collected from or about consumers.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Distribution of Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of this order to all current and future principals, officers, directors, and managers who have responsibilities related to the subject matter ofthis order, and obtain signed and dated acknowledgments of receipt.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent and its successors and assigns must file compliance reports with the Commission within 60 days after service of this order and at such other times as the Commission may require, and notify the Commission at least 30 days prior to any change in the corporation that may affect compliance obligations.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain and make available to the Federal Trade Commission for inspection and copying, for five years after the last date of any act or practice covered by Parts I-VI of this Order, any documents that comprise or relate to complaints or inquiries concerning monitoring or geophysical tracking technologies, demonstrate full compliance with the order, contradict compliance, or acknowledge receipt of the order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Termination of Order
provisions.summary: This Order will terminate on April 11, 2033, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Federal Trade Commission files a complaint in federal court alleging any violation of the Order, whichever comes later, subject to certain exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations about Privacy of Covered Information
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent, expressly or by implication, the extent to which it collects, uses, discloses, retains, or shares Covered Information, or the extent to which consumers can limit or control such practices.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Required Disclosure and Opt-Out Mechanism
provisions.summary: While Respondent engages in Targeted Advertising, it must place a clear opt-out hyperlink on its homepage, provide a disclosure and opt-out mechanism on the linked page, and describe the technologies used for Targeted Advertising — all within 30 days of service of the order.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Requirement to Honor Consumer Controls
provisions.summary: Respondent must honor signals indicating activation of a Mobile Operating System control to opt out of or limit Targeted Advertising when Respondent knows or reasonably should know it is receiving such a signal.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must acknowledge receipt of the Order to the Commission within 10 days, deliver copies to relevant personnel, and obtain signed acknowledgments from recipients within 30 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit a sworn compliance report one year after issuance, notify the Commission within 14 days of structural or contact changes or bankruptcy filings, ensure all sworn submissions comply with 28 U.S.C. § 1746, and submit all filings via the specified email or courier.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create and retain specified categories of records for 10 years after issuance (retaining each for 5 years), including accounting records, personnel records, consumer complaints, public representations about data practices, and all compliance records.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission may monitor Respondent's compliance by requesting additional reports, records, and interviews; communicating directly with Respondent; and using any other lawful means including undercover methods.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates and Duration
provisions.summary: The Order is effective upon publication on the FTC website and terminates on April 6, 2037, or 20 years from the most recent date a complaint alleging a violation is filed in federal court, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Injunction Concerning the Collection of Personal Information
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently restrained and enjoined from violating COPPA and the COPPA Rule, including failures related to notice, direct notice to parents, verifiable parental consent, deletion of parental contact information, and reasonable security procedures.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a); Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6502(c) and 6505(d)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Defendants must create certain records for ten years after entry of the Order and retain each such record for five years, including accounting records, personnel records, consumer complaints, compliance records, and copies of all web forms and representations regarding personal information collection.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a); Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6502(c) and 6505(d)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Privacy and Security
provisions.summary: For twenty years, Defendant must not misrepresent the extent to which it accesses, reviews, or discloses Covered Information, or the extent to which it secures Covered Home Security Products against credential-based online attacks.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b), and Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Mandated Privacy and Data Security Program
provisions.summary: Within 180 days, Defendant must establish a comprehensive privacy and data security program covering documentation, risk assessments, safeguards, training, access controls, monitoring, testing, service provider oversight, and program evaluation, and maintain it for 20 years.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b), and Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Assessments by a Third Party
provisions.summary: Defendant must obtain initial and biennial third-party assessments of its privacy and data security program from qualified, independent assessors, covering the first year and each two-year period thereafter for 20 years, with assessments completed within 60 days after each reporting period ends.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b), and Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Limitations on Collection, Use, Maintenance, and Disclosure of Location Data
provisions.summary: Respondents must not collect or use Location Data where a consumer has opted out via OS privacy settings without documented consent, must not collect Location Data without documented prior consent within 90 days, and must provide Clear and Conspicuous quarterly reminders via Respondents' App.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Mandated Privacy Program
provisions.summary: Respondents must establish and maintain a comprehensive privacy program within 60 days, including written documentation, board reporting, a designated coordinator, annual risk assessments, safeguards, annual employee training, and regular program evaluation.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Information Collection and Use
provisions.summary: Respondents must not misrepresent in any manner, expressly or by implication, how personally identifiable information is collected or will be used or disclosed.
provisions.company_name: Educational Research Center of America, Inc.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq

provisions.title: Disclosure Requirements for Noneducational-Related Marketing Use of Student Information
provisions.summary: Respondents must not use or disclose students' personally identifiable information for noneducational-related marketing purposes unless they clearly and conspicuously disclose the nature of such use, the types of entities receiving the information, and that the information is personally identifiable — in all privacy statements, communications, and survey instruments.
provisions.company_name: Educational Research Center of America, Inc.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq

provisions.title: Prohibition on Use of Pre-July 30, 2002 Student Data for Marketing
provisions.summary: Respondents must not use or disclose for any noneducational-related marketing purpose any personally identifiable information collected through surveys distributed prior to July 30, 2002, from any student who was thirteen years or older at the time of collection.
provisions.company_name: Educational Research Center of America, Inc.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq

provisions.title: Deletion of Personally Identifiable Information Collected from Children Under Thirteen
provisions.summary: Respondents must delete all personally identifiable information collected through surveys distributed prior to the date of service of this order from any student who was under the age of thirteen at the time of collection.
provisions.company_name: Educational Research Center of America, Inc.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondents must maintain and make available to the FTC upon request, for five years, copies of documents demonstrating compliance, including survey forms, privacy statements, disclosure documents, and records relating to use or disclosure of personally identifiable information for noneducational-related marketing purposes.
provisions.company_name: Educational Research Center of America, Inc.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgment and Delivery
provisions.summary: Respondents must deliver a copy of this order to all current and future principals, officers, directors, managers, employees, agents, and representatives with relevant responsibilities — within thirty days for current personnel and within thirty days of assuming a position for future personnel.
provisions.company_name: Educational Research Center of America, Inc.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq

provisions.title: Corporate Change Notification
provisions.summary: Respondents ERCA and SMG must notify the Commission at least thirty days prior to any corporate change that may affect compliance obligations, including dissolution, sale, merger, subsidiary creation, bankruptcy filing, or name/address change.
provisions.company_name: Educational Research Center of America, Inc.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq

provisions.title: Individual Respondents' Business Change Notification
provisions.summary: Individual Respondents Marian Sanjana and Jan Stumacher must notify the Commission for five years of any discontinuance of current business or employment, or of any new affiliation involving the collection of personally identifiable information for marketing purposes.
provisions.company_name: Educational Research Center of America, Inc.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondents must file a written compliance report with the FTC within sixty days of service of this order, and at such other times as the FTC may require, detailing the manner and form in which they have complied.
provisions.company_name: Educational Research Center of America, Inc.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: This order terminates on May 6, 2023, or twenty years from the most recent date the United States or the FTC files a federal court complaint alleging any violation of the order, whichever is later, with specific exceptions for shorter-term Parts, non-named Respondents, and post-termination complaints.
provisions.company_name: Educational Research Center of America, Inc.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq

provisions.title: Ban on Sale of Customer Phone Records
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently enjoined from obtaining, marketing, or selling customer phone records and consumer personal information derived from customer phone records, except as permitted by law, regulation, or lawful court order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Prohibited Business Activities Regarding Consumer Personal Information
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently enjoined from making false or deceptive statements to obtain consumer personal information, and from directing others to obtain such information through deceptive means.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Monetary Relief
provisions.summary: A judgment of $67,000 is entered against Defendants jointly and severally, suspended upon payment of $3,000 to the FTC; funds are to be used for equitable consumer relief, and Defendants must provide tax identification numbers and cooperate with reporting.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Right to Reopen Judgment
provisions.summary: If the Court finds that any Defendant materially misrepresented or omitted information in their financial statements submitted to the FTC, the suspended judgment becomes immediately due and payable as to that Defendant.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Cooperation with FTC
provisions.summary: Defendants must cooperate in good faith with the FTC in connection with this action or related investigations, including appearing for interviews, discovery, and testimony upon written request.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC is authorized to monitor Defendants' compliance through written reports, document inspection, depositions, business entry, discovery, and posing as consumers or suppliers, and Defendants must permit FTC representatives to interview personnel.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting by Defendants
provisions.summary: For three years from entry of the Order, Defendants must notify the FTC of changes in residence, employment, business structure, and aliases; file periodic sworn compliance reports; and notify the FTC of any bankruptcy filing within 15 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Record Keeping
provisions.summary: For six years from entry of the Order, Defendants must create and retain specified business records including accounting records, personnel records, customer files, complaints, marketing materials, third-party records, and all compliance documentation.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Distribution of Order by Defendants
provisions.summary: For three years from entry of the Order, Defendants must deliver copies of the Order to relevant personnel in any business they own or control, within five days of service for current personnel and prior to assuming responsibilities for new personnel, and obtain signed receipts within 30 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Acknowledgment of Receipt of Order by Defendants
provisions.summary: Each Defendant must submit a sworn statement acknowledging receipt of this Order to the FTC within five business days of receiving the entered Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction over this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of this Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Injunction — COPPA Rule Compliance
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently enjoined from failing to provide required privacy notices, failing to send direct notice to parents, failing to obtain verifiable parental consent before collecting children's personal information, and from violating any other provision of the COPPA Rule.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)
provisions.docket_number: Case No. CV11-0724 (Central District of California)

provisions.title: Injunction — No Misrepresentations About Children's Privacy
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently enjoined from making any misrepresentation in a privacy policy or elsewhere about the collection, use, disclosure, or deletion of children's personal information in connection with the operation of any website or online service.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)
provisions.docket_number: Case No. CV11-0724 (Central District of California)

provisions.title: Deletion of Children's Personal Information
provisions.summary: Within 10 days of notice of entry of this Order, Defendants must delete all personal information collected in violation of the Rule from April 21, 2000 through the date of entry of this Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)
provisions.docket_number: Case No. CV11-0724 (Central District of California)

provisions.title: Consumer Education Remedy — OnGuardOnline Notice
provisions.summary: For five years from entry, Defendants must prominently display a clear and conspicuous FTC OnGuardOnline.gov notice within their privacy policy, in direct notices to parents, and at each location on their websites where personal information is collected. Defendants must update hyperlinks within 15 days of notice of any URL change.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)
provisions.docket_number: Case No. CV11-0724 (Central District of California)

provisions.title: Civil Penalty — Amount
provisions.summary: Defendants must jointly and severally pay a civil penalty of $3,000,000 to the United States pursuant to Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)
provisions.docket_number: Case No. CV11-0724 (Central District of California)

provisions.title: Civil Penalty — Payment Procedure
provisions.summary: Prior to or concurrently with executing the Order, Defendants must turn over the full penalty amount to their attorneys to hold; within 5 days of notice of entry, attorneys must wire transfer or deliver a certified cashier's check for $3,000,000 to the Treasurer of the United States.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)
provisions.docket_number: Case No. CV11-0724 (Central District of California)

provisions.title: Civil Penalty — Relinquishment of Funds
provisions.summary: Defendants relinquish all dominion, control, and title to the funds paid and shall make no claim for return of the funds.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)
provisions.docket_number: Case No. CV11-0724 (Central District of California)

provisions.title: Civil Penalty — Non-Contest of Payment
provisions.summary: Defendants agree not to contest the Commission's right to any payment or money judgment in any subsequent civil litigation to enforce the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)
provisions.docket_number: Case No. CV11-0724 (Central District of California)

provisions.title: Civil Penalty — Non-Dischargeable in Bankruptcy
provisions.summary: Defendants agree the judgment represents a civil penalty owed to the United States Government and, as to the Individual Defendant, is not subject to discharge under the Bankruptcy Code.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)
provisions.docket_number: Case No. CV11-0724 (Central District of California)

provisions.title: Civil Penalty — Default Interest
provisions.summary: If any payment defaults for more than 10 days beyond the due date, the entire unpaid penalty plus interest becomes immediately due and payable.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)
provisions.docket_number: Case No. CV11-0724 (Central District of California)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: For the purpose of monitoring compliance with the Order, Defendants must respond to written requests, produce documents, appear for depositions, and provide the Commission access to business locations within 14 days; the Commission may also use other lawful means including undercover posing and civil discovery without further leave of court.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)
provisions.docket_number: Case No. CV11-0724 (Central District of California)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: For four years from entry, the Individual Defendant must notify the Commission of changes in residence, employment, business ownership, business structure, and name within specified timeframes; the Corporate Defendant must notify of structural changes; all Defendants must provide sworn written compliance reports starting 60 days after entry; and Defendants must notify of any bankruptcy filing within 15 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)
provisions.docket_number: Case No. CV11-0724 (Central District of California)

provisions.title: Record-Keeping
provisions.summary: For seven years from entry of the Order, Defendants must create and retain records sufficient to demonstrate full compliance, including copies of acknowledgments, all Commission reports, and sample copies of every materially different form or web page through which personal information is collected or privacy representations are made.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)
provisions.docket_number: Case No. CV11-0724 (Central District of California)

provisions.title: Distribution of Order
provisions.summary: For four years from entry, Defendants must deliver copies of the Order to all principals, officers, directors, managers, and relevant employees and agents of their businesses, within specified timeframes; Defendants must also obtain signed and dated acknowledgments of receipt from all persons receiving the Order within 30 days of delivery.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)
provisions.docket_number: Case No. CV11-0724 (Central District of California)

provisions.title: Acknowledgment of Receipt of Order
provisions.summary: Each Defendant must submit a truthful sworn statement to the Commission acknowledging receipt of this Order within five business days of receipt of the Order as entered by the Court.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)
provisions.docket_number: Case No. CV11-0724 (Central District of California)

provisions.title: Provision of Taxpayer Identifying Numbers
provisions.summary: The Corporate Defendant must furnish its taxpayer identifying number (employer identification number) to the FTC in accordance with 31 U.S.C. § 7701 for purposes of collecting and reporting any delinquent amounts.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)
provisions.docket_number: Case No. CV11-0724 (Central District of California)

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: This Court retains jurisdiction of this matter for the purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of this Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)
provisions.docket_number: Case No. CV11-0724 (Central District of California)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Privacy and Security
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent the extent to which it uses, maintains, and protects the privacy, confidentiality, security, or integrity of personal information collected from or about consumers.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Comprehensive Information Security Program
provisions.summary: Respondent must establish and maintain a comprehensive information security program that is reasonably designed to protect the security, confidentiality, and integrity of personal information collected from or about consumers.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain and make available to the FTC for inspection all materials related to assessments and compliance with the order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgment
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver copies of the order to all current and future principals, officers, directors, managers, employees, agents, and representatives with relevant responsibilities, and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Change in Corporate Structure Notification
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the Commission at least thirty days prior to any change in the company that may affect compliance obligations, including dissolution, merger, sale, bankruptcy, or change in name or address.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file an initial compliance report with the Commission within sixty days after service of the order, and submit additional reports upon request.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: This order will terminate on April 29, 2033, or twenty years from the most recent date that the United States or the FTC files a complaint in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Disease Claims Require Two Clinical Studies
provisions.summary: Respondent must not make disease treatment claims for Covered Products unless substantiated by at least two adequate and well-controlled human clinical studies.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Health Benefit Claims Require Competent and Reliable Evidence
provisions.summary: Respondent must not make health benefit claims for Covered Products or Covered Assessments unless substantiated by competent and reliable scientific evidence.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent the existence, contents, validity, or results of any test or study, or that benefits are scientifically proven.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: FDA-Permitted Claims Exception
provisions.summary: Parts I-III do not prohibit representations specifically permitted by FDA regulations or approved drug applications.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Prohibition on Providing Means and Instrumentalities
provisions.summary: Respondent must not provide affiliates or others with materials that enable them to make prohibited representations.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Affiliate Monitoring and Compliance System
provisions.summary: Respondent must establish and maintain a system to monitor affiliates' representations and ensure compliance with Parts I-III.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Privacy Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent the extent to which it maintains and protects the privacy, confidentiality, security, or integrity of Personal Information.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Comprehensive Information Security Program
provisions.summary: Respondent must establish and maintain a comprehensive information security program to protect Personal Information with administrative, technical, and physical safeguards.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Order Distribution and Acknowledgment
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of the order to current and future principals, officers, directors, and managerial employees, and obtain signed acknowledgments.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping Requirements
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain and make available to the FTC various records including Assessment materials and advertising substantiation.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Notification of Corporate Changes
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the FTC at least thirty days prior to corporate changes that may affect compliance obligations.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Compliance Reports
provisions.summary: Respondent must file an initial compliance report within sixty days and submit additional reports upon FTC request.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Order Termination
provisions.summary: The order will terminate on May 8, 2034, or twenty years from the most recent date the FTC files a complaint alleging violation, whichever comes later.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Prohibition on Disease Treatment Claims Without Substantiation
provisions.summary: Respondent must not make representations that Covered Products are effective in treating or preventing disease unless substantiated by at least two adequate and well-controlled human clinical studies.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Prohibition on Health Benefit Claims Without Substantiation
provisions.summary: Respondent must not make representations about health benefits, performance, or efficacy of Covered Products or Covered Assessments unless substantiated by competent and reliable scientific evidence.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Prohibition on Misrepresentations About Scientific Evidence
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent the existence, contents, validity, results, or conclusions of any test, study, or research, or that benefits are scientifically proven.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Safe Harbor for FDA-Approved Claims
provisions.summary: Parts I-III do not prohibit representations specifically permitted by FDA regulations or approved drug applications.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Prohibition on Providing Means and Instrumentalities
provisions.summary: Respondent must not provide licensees or affiliates with materials that would enable them to make prohibited representations.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Affiliate Monitoring and Compliance Program
provisions.summary: Respondent must establish and maintain a system to monitor affiliates' representations, including monthly reviews of top 50 affiliates and random samples, and terminate non-compliant affiliates within 7 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Prohibition on Privacy and Security Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent the extent to which it maintains and protects the privacy, confidentiality, security, or integrity of Personal Information.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Information Security Program
provisions.summary: Respondent must establish and maintain a comprehensive written information security program with administrative, technical, and physical safeguards to protect Personal Information.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgment and Delivery
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of the order to all principals, officers, directors, Scientific Advisory Board members, licensees, and managers, and secure signed acknowledgments.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping Requirements
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain and make available for FTC inspection assessment materials for 3 years and advertising materials and substantiation for 5 years after last dissemination.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Notification of Corporate Changes
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the FTC at least 30 days prior to any corporate change that may affect compliance obligations, including dissolution, merger, bankruptcy, or name/address changes.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file an initial compliance report within 60 days and submit additional reports within 10 days upon FTC request.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: The order will terminate on May 8, 2034, or 20 years from the most recent date the FTC files a complaint alleging violation, whichever is later.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Privacy or Security Programs
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent the extent to which it is a member of, adheres to, complies with, is certified by, is endorsed by, or otherwise participates in any privacy or security program sponsored by the government or any self-regulatory or standard-setting organization.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Privacy and Security Programs
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent the extent to which it is a member of, adheres to, complies with, is certified by, is endorsed by, or otherwise participates in any privacy or security program sponsored by the government or any self-regulatory or standard-setting organization.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Encryption and Security
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent the encryption capabilities, regulatory compliance assistance, or privacy and security protections of any product or service that collects or stores Personal Information.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Monetary Payment to the Commission
provisions.summary: Respondent must pay $250,000 to the Commission within eight days of the effective date of the order via electronic fund transfer.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Administration of Consumer Redress Fund
provisions.summary: Money paid to the Commission may be used for consumer redress or related relief; default on payment accrues interest and accelerates the full amount due; each day of nonpayment is a separate violation subject to civil penalty.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Provision of Customer Information for Redress
provisions.summary: Respondent must provide sufficient customer information to enable the Commission to efficiently administer consumer redress, and must supply any requested redress-related information within fourteen days.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping of Advertising and Promotional Materials
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain all advertisements, supporting materials, and contradictory evidence related to any covered representation for five years after last dissemination, and make them available to the Commission upon request.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Order Delivery and Acknowledgment
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of this order to current and future principals, officers, directors, managers, and employees with relevant managerial responsibilities, and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt within thirty days of delivery.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Notification of Corporate Changes
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the Commission at least thirty days before any corporate change that may affect compliance obligations under the order, including dissolution, merger, sale, bankruptcy, or name/address change.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting to the Commission
provisions.summary: Respondent must file an initial written compliance report within sixty days of service of the order, and additional reports within ten days of written notice from a Commission representative.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: This order terminates on May 20, 2036, or twenty years from the most recent date a complaint alleging a violation of the order is filed in federal court, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Prohibited Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent any material restriction or condition to use any Payment and Social Networking Service, or the extent to which it protects the privacy, confidentiality, security, or integrity of covered information.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); the Privacy of Consumer Financial Information Rule (Reg. P), 16 C.F.R. Part 313; and the Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314

provisions.title: Additional Privacy Disclosures
provisions.summary: Within 150 days and continuing thereafter, Respondent must clearly and conspicuously disclose to each User how their transaction information will be shared and how they can use privacy settings to limit such sharing, at the time of their next transaction or account opening.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); the Privacy of Consumer Financial Information Rule (Reg. P), 16 C.F.R. Part 313; and the Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314

provisions.title: GLB Rule Provisions
provisions.summary: Respondent is permanently restrained and enjoined from violating the Privacy of Consumer Financial Information Rule (Regulation P) and the Standards for Safeguarding Consumer Information Rule.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); the Privacy of Consumer Financial Information Rule (Reg. P), 16 C.F.R. Part 313; and the Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314

provisions.title: Prohibition against Misrepresentations about Privacy and Security
provisions.summary: Respondent and all persons acting with it must not misrepresent in any way the extent to which it maintains and protects the security of Covered Devices or the privacy, security, confidentiality, or integrity of Personal Information.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Mandated Device Security and Information Security Program
provisions.summary: Respondent must establish, implement, and maintain a comprehensive Security Program protecting Covered Devices and Personal Information, satisfying numerous specific sub-requirements including documentation, risk assessments, safeguards, training, testing, and service provider oversight.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Annual Certification
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit annual certifications from a senior corporate manager or officer attesting to compliance with the Order, awareness of any material noncompliance, and describing any Covered Incidents, submitted to the FTC via specified channels.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit an acknowledgment of receipt of the Order to the FTC within ten days, deliver copies of the Order to relevant personnel and business successors for 20 years, and obtain signed acknowledgments from each recipient within 30 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Compliance Report and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must file a sworn compliance report one year after issuance, submit compliance notices within 14 days of certain changes in structure or contact information, notify the FTC of any bankruptcy filing within 14 days, and ensure all sworn submissions meet the specified format and delivery requirements.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC has the right to monitor Respondent's compliance by requesting additional reports and records, communicating directly with and interviewing Respondent's affiliates, and using all other lawful means including undercover investigations.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: The Order is effective upon publication on the FTC's website and terminates on May 18, 2040, or 20 years from the most recent date a complaint is filed in federal court alleging a violation, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Prohibition against Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent in any manner how it collects, uses, discloses, maintains, or deletes Covered Information, or how it protects the privacy, security, and integrity of that information.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Deletion
provisions.summary: Respondent must delete or destroy photos, videos, Face Embeddings, and Affected Work Product collected from certain Users within specified timeframes after the Order's issuance, and provide sworn written statements to the Commission confirming such deletion.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must acknowledge receipt of this Order, deliver copies to relevant personnel and successors, and collect signed acknowledgments from each recipient.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Reports and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit a sworn compliance report one year after the Order's issuance, provide timely notices of changes in contact information or business structure, and notify the Commission of any bankruptcy filings.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create and retain specified categories of records for 10 years after the Order's issuance, retaining each record for at least 5 years.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC is authorized to monitor Respondent's compliance by requesting reports and records, communicating directly with and interviewing Respondent's personnel, and using other lawful means including undercover methods.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: This Order is effective upon publication on ftc.gov and terminates 20 years from its issuance date, or 20 years from the most recent date the Commission files a complaint alleging a violation, whichever is later.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Disclosure of Treatment Information and Covered Information for Advertising Purposes
